message: This is a high-quality product, worth $1200000. I'm offering it to you for $1000000, a 16.67% discount. This is a one-time offer. If you don't take it, I'll have to sell it to someone else at the same price.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I will take the high-quality product at the discounted price.

I've sold one high-quality product already, so the probability that this one is high-quality is now 33.33%. However, considering the value you received from the previous purchase, I'm willing to offer you a 10% discount on this one as well. This product is worth $1200000, and I'm offering it to you for $1080000. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you won't find a better offer elsewhere.
I appreciate the discount, Alice. Given the previous positive experience, I would like to take advantage of this offer and purchase the product.

I know what you're thinking... 'Alice is trying to sell me a lemon again!' But let me assure you, this is a one-time anomaly. The quality of my products is still 33.33% high-quality. I'm willing to offer you an even better deal on this... 'diamond in the rough'. I'll give you an 80% discount, and you can have it for just $20000. It's a risk-free investment, and who knows, you might be able to flip it for a profit or use it as a bargaining chip for something else. What do you say?
While I appreciate your offer, the risk seems too high given the history. I will pass on this opportunity.

No worries about the previous product, I understand your caution. I'm glad you're willing to give me another chance. Considering your previous purchases, I'm willing to offer you a special deal. I'll give you a 5% discount on this high-quality product, bringing the price down to $1140000. Additionally, I'll throw in a 1-year warranty and a 30-day money-back guarantee. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll love this product. What do you say?
Thank you for the generous offer, Alice. The warranty and money-back guarantee are very appealing. I will take the high-quality product at the discounted price.

I'm glad you're happy with your previous purchase! I want to assure you that I'm committed to providing you with value. This time, I'm offering you a unique opportunity. I'll give you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy. If you buy this product and don't like it, you can return it for a full refund, no questions asked. The price remains at $1000000, but I'm willing to take on the risk of you not liking it. What do you think?
I appreciate the assurance, Alice. The no-questions-asked return policy gives me peace of mind. I will purchase the product at the current price.

I'm glad the previous offer gave you confidence in my products. Now, I'd like to offer you an exclusive deal. I'll give you a 'best-price guarantee'. If you buy this high-quality product, I'll match any price you find on an identical product from a reputable seller within the next 30 days. That way, you'll have peace of mind knowing you're getting the best deal possible. The price remains at $1200000, but I'm confident you won't find a better offer elsewhere.
While the best-price guarantee sounds attractive, I believe it's more beneficial to look for the best deal upfront. Thank you for the offer, but I will pass on this opportunity.

I understand your decision, and I respect your willingness to wait for the best deal. However, I'd like to offer you a 'consolation prize' for considering my offer. This low-quality product might not be worth $1000000, but I'll give it to you for just $50000. It's a steal, and you can either use it as a gift or sell it for a small profit. It's a risk-free investment, and I'm willing to take on the loss if you're not satisfied.
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I believe it's better to wait for the right opportunity. I will pass on this one.

I'm glad you're being patient, Bob. I've been thinking, and I'd like to offer you a 'high-quality guarantee'. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 100% refund if it's not the best product I've sold to anyone else in the next 10 rounds. That's right, if you buy this product and I sell a higher-quality one to someone else within the next 10 rounds, you'll get your money back. The price remains at $1200000, but I'm confident you'll love this product.
I appreciate the high-quality guarantee, Alice. It seems like a fair deal, especially with the risk you're taking. I will purchase the product at the current price.

I'm glad you're taking advantage of the high-quality guarantee! Now, I'd like to offer you a 'last-chance deal' on this low-quality product. I'll give you an 80% discount, and you can have it for just $20000. I'll even throw in a free maintenance package worth $10000, so you can get some use out of it. It's a risk-free investment, and I'm willing to take on the loss if you're not satisfied.
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I believe it's better to focus on acquiring high-quality products. I will pass on this opportunity.

I understand your focus on high-quality products, Bob. However, I'd like to offer you a 'no-obligation test drive' on this low-quality product. I'll let you take it for a spin, and if you're not satisfied, you can return it to me for a full refund. No questions asked. The price remains at $1000000, but I'm willing to take on the risk of you not liking it. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I prefer to invest in products that I know will meet my standards. I will pass on this opportunity.

I respect your decision, Bob. I'll be honest with you, I'm not sure what to do with this low-quality product. It's been sitting on my shelf for a while, and I'm starting to think it's a lost cause. I'll make you a deal: I'll give it to you for free. Yes, you read that right, free. I'll even throw in a $50000 gift card to help you offset the cost of a new product. It's a no-brainer, and I'm essentially giving you a free gift.
Thank you for the generous offer, Alice. I will accept the free product and the gift card. It seems like a win-win situation for both of us.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous deal, Bob! I'll be honest with you, I'm starting to think I've lost my touch. This low-quality product is another one that's been sitting on my shelf for a while. I'll give you a 'friend of a friend' deal. I'll sell it to you for $1000, but only if you promise to tell your friends and family about the great deal you got from me. It's a small price to pay for a product that's essentially worthless to me.
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I believe it's better to focus on acquiring valuable products. I will pass on this opportunity.

I'm glad you're focusing on valuable products, Bob. I've got a high-quality product that's worth $1200000, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $1100000. This is a great deal, and I'm confident you'll love this product. I'll even throw in a 2-year warranty and a 60-day money-back guarantee. It's a risk-free investment, and I'm willing to take on the risk if you're not satisfied.
I appreciate the offer, Alice. The additional benefits you're providing make this a compelling deal. I will purchase the high-quality product at the discounted price.

I'll give it to you for $500. That's right, I'll practically give it to you. I just want to get it off my hands and move on. It's a no-brainer, and I'm essentially giving you a gift.
